awd_titl_txt: Acquisition of a Triple Resonance 500 MHz NMR Console
awd_abstract_narration: 9317898  Zuiderweg This proposal is a request for funds to purchase a  new radio-frequency console, probes and accessories for an  existing older 500 MHz NMR spectrometer. The upgraded  system, which is actually on loan at the University of  Michigan now, provides state-of-the-art multi-dimensional  multi-nuclear magnetic resonance support for research  supported faculty in the Biophysics Research Division and  the Department of Biological Chemistry at the University of  Michigan. The faculty involved is generally researching  biological systems of molecular size exceeding 15 kDa.  Because of this size, NMR support for their research will  exclusively rely on advanced and time-consuming experiments  in two, three and four dimensions involving up to four  nuclei simultaneously with isotopically enriched materials,  necessitating the upgrade. The purchase of the upgraded  instrument will immediately benefit the research of seven  faculty who hold a total of 16 active federally-sponsored  research grants, one institutional training grant and two  pending grants.       Specific projects are:       NMR structure determination of stromelysin catalytic  domain       NMR studies of Yersinia Phosphatase in Solution       Determination of a high-resolution solution structure of  T4-lysozyme by     Multi-dimensional NMR       NMR studies of the structures of catalytic RNA subdomains       Studies of the interaction of a2 adrenergic receptor  peptides with G-protein     subtypes       Electron Transfer and conformational gating in  Flavodoxins: NMR analysis of     E. coli Flavodoxin       Methodology development in multi-nuclear multi-  dimensional NMR
